items.name: Ext.grid.plugin.Clipboard
items.text: This Ext.grid.Panel plugin adds clipboard support to a grid. *Note that the grid must use the Ext.grid.selection.SpreadsheetModel to utilize this plugin.* This class supports the following Ext.plugin.AbstractClipboard#formats for grid data: * `cell` - Complete field data that can be matched to other grids using the same Ext.data.Model regardless of column order. * `text` - Cell content stripped of HTML tags. * `html` - Complete cell content, including any rendered HTML tags. * `raw` - Underlying field values based on `dataIndex`. The `cell` format is not valid for the Ext.plugin.AbstractClipboard#system clipboard format.

items.name: formats
memory
items.text:
The data format(s) to copy to the private, memory clipboard. By default, data
is not saved to the memory clipboard. Specify `true` to include all formats
of data, or a string to copy a single format, or an array of strings to copy
multiple formats.

items.name: pluginId
source
items.text:
The format or formats in order of preference when pasting data. This list can
be any of the valid formats, plus the name "system". When a paste occurs, this
config is consulted. The first format specified by this config that has data
available in the private memory space is used. If "system" is encountered in
the list, whatever data is available on the system clipboard is chosen. At
that point, no further source formats will be considered.

items.name: stateEvents
items.text: The configured list of stateEvents used to (optionally) participate in Owner Component's state management.

items.name: system
items.text:
The data format to set in the system clipboard. By default, the "text"
format is used. Based on the type of derived class, other formats may be
possible.

items.name: applyState
items.text:
The applyState method is invoked by the client Component's State mixin after initComponent method has been run for the client.

The supplied implementation is empty. If plugin Subclasses are to (optionally) participate in the client Component's
state management, implementers should provide a suitable method to utilize it.

items.name: state
items.text: The current plugin state object to be applied.

items.name: allState
items.text: The current aggregate state of the Component and all plugins.

items.name: clonePlugin
items.text: Creates clone of the plugin.

items.name: overrideCfg
items.text: Additional config for the derived plugin.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Instantiates the plugin.

items.name: config
items.text: Configuration object.

items.name: destroy
items.text:
The destroy method is invoked by the owning Component at the time the Component is
being destroyed.

items.name: disable
items.text:
The base implementation just sets the plugin's `disabled` flag to `true`

Plugin subclasses which need more complex processing may implement an overriding implementation.

items.name: enable
items.text:
The base implementation just sets the plugin's `disabled` flag to `false`

Plugin subclasses which need more complex processing may implement an overriding implementation.

items.name: getCmp
items.text: Returns the component to which this plugin is attached.
Owner component.

items.name: getState
items.text: The getState method is invoked by the client Component's State mixin when one or more of the the specified stateEvents are raised. The supplied implementation is empty. If plugin Subclasses are to (optionally) participate in the client Component's state management, implementers should provide a suitable method which returns a state object.
state

items.name: getTarget
items.text: Returns the element target to listen to copy/paste.

items.name: comp
items.text: The component this plugin is initialized on.
The element target.

items.name: getTextData
items.text: This method returns the selected data in text format.

items.name: format
items.text: The name of the format (i.e., "text").

items.name: erase
items.text: Pass `true` to erase (cut) the data, `false` to just copy.
The data in text format.

items.name: init
items.text:
The init method is invoked after initComponent method has been run for the client Component.

The supplied implementation is empty. Subclasses should perform plugin initialization, and set up bidirectional
links between the plugin and its client Component in their own implementation of this method.

items.name: client
items.text: The client Component which owns this plugin.

items.name: putTextData
items.text: This method pastes the given text data.

items.name: data
items.text: The data in the indicated `format`.

items.name: format
items.text: The name of the format (i.e., "text").

items.name: setCmp
items.text: Sets the component to which this plugin is attached.

items.name: cmp
items.text: Owner component.

items.name: isPlugin
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Plugin, or subclass thereof.

items.name: shared
items.text: The shared state for all clipboard-enabled components.

items.name: counter
items.text:
The number of clipboard-enabled components
currently using this object.

items.name: data
items.text:
The clipboard data for intra-page copy/paste. The
properties of the object are keyed by format.
